intro: Symplocos elliptifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sand cherry, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It features elliptical, glossy leaves that are typically 2–5 cm in length. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during the spring. Its fruit is a small, dark red drupe that ripens in the fall. Symplocos elliptifolia is often found in moist woodlands and stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full shade.
